rounds.pro_tip: PETAL EDGES: Real rose petals have slightly irregular edges, natural browning or curling at tips, and visible veining when backlit. AI petals are often too uniform, like plastic flowers.
DEPTH LAYERING: Real photographs have natural depth cues — slightly soft backgrounds, accurate size scaling with distance. AI often creates a flat collage-like composition where depth feels staged.

CHOCOLATE SHEEN: Real chocolate has a specific glossy sheen from tempering, with subtle fingerprint marks and varied reflections. AI chocolate often looks matte or has an impossible mirror-like shine.
SYMMETRY OVERLOAD: AI loves bilateral symmetry in romantic scenes — perfectly matched candles, identically arranged flowers. Real romantic settings have charming imperfection and asymmetry.
CANDLELIGHT: Real candle flames cast warm, flickering light that creates soft, shifting shadows. AI candlelight is often static and creates shadows that don't match the flame position.

EARRINGS AND JEWELRY: Real jewelry has consistent metallic properties — reflection, refraction, shadow casting. AI jewelry often has impossible geometry, floating elements, or inconsistent material properties.
BOKEH QUALITY: Real lens bokeh has characteristic shapes from the aperture blade count, with natural color fringing at edges. AI bokeh is often too perfectly circular with uniform brightness.
COLOR GRADING: AI tends to over-saturate warm tones in romantic scenes, creating an Instagram-filter-on-steroids look. Real photos have more nuanced color temperature variation.
LIQUID BUBBLES: Real champagne bubbles form at nucleation points and rise in streams, varying in size. AI bubbles are often randomly scattered, uniform in size, and don't follow physics.

MECHANICAL MEETS ORGANIC: When real metal holds something organic like a flower, you see natural shadows, compression of the stem, and light interaction between materials. AI blends these unnaturally.
